8.21.17  12:38 pm   How do I keep track of the difference between objective and subjective? I always get these 2 words mixed up. 

     the main purpose of those words is to convince the person you are talking to that you are smarter than them, and also that your opinion is universally true and theirs is only true to them. the ambiguous sound of the words will help disguise the simplicity of this tactic, and make it more effective

8.21.17  11:36 am   Regarding the french augmented sixth chord: The chord is used in cadences. In the key of c, the French augmented sixth chord would be Ab-C-D-F# leading to the 'clean V' (as I call it), G-B-D-G, or even better, the Gsus4. The most common use of the augmented sixth chord (google it if you're into nerdy music theory) is the German augmented sixth chord; Ab-C-Eb-F# (in the key of c), that then leads to the cadential dominant 6/4 chord (G-C-E-G) that leads to the 'clean V' and finally to the tonic of c. As a professional classical musician, the German aug. sixth chord is by far my favorite chord (in cadences), so I guess my question is; now that you know about it and you're good at writing catchy jingles, would you consider using it in your music?

     i think i already have

8.20.17  1:31 pm   8.19.17  2:31 pm

i am not sure about what we have to do to become real and i don't know if we will be able to do that but i know what we have been and what we are now: ghosts of other people's desires, those who came before. now is past and vice versa and we are both. don't you think we are puppets of recurring history, the starts, the ends, big bangs and dooms? don't you believe we can become real if we change the future?

     if we are not real then what the heck is the word 'real' supposed to be used for

8.20.17  1:29 pm   after having written down your memories in a word processor and offloaded it onto hard drives or internet, will you find them unreal or artificial in some way? if so is it better not to type those memorable down?

     there are advantages and disadvantages to writing it down. one of the disadvantages of not writing it down is no one else will ever know about it

8.20.17  1:21 pm   possibilities scare me. each one of them comes with a -and more- different future(s). nobody can see them all, which makes the first move even more scarier. it's where you become the aphelion itself, the furthest point from the sun. you don't know what will happen if you begin your journey. stars may burn you, you can get lost in emptiness of nothing, everything may be terrible. even if the end is bad, it's existence is relaxing since it means everything is temporary and nothing lasts forever but when you ARE the aphelion, the end is far away as much as your dreams shining bright like the sun. there is an infinite space of possibilities between you and your biggest fears, as much as everything you have ever wished and everything you have gone through is for you to be at that point. there are so many ways to start changing your world and the world, to write, to tell stories and the universes i imagined, so many words... i don't have the guts to start all over (again). you lived similar yet different things in music, at least that's what i understand. i really need your help. i can't get focused on just one project, inspiration and creativity are like my curse and i give a deep meaning in every damn thing around me, i want to write about all of them. i always try to calculate the chaos of probabilities in my mind, i of course can't. this makes me leave everything i started unfinished and like if i am in a vicious circle, i find myself in that aphelion point AGAIN to start another project after the other one i only completed the first layer of. i begin to be afraid of taking the pen in my hands that is basically my life. how did you do that? how did you dare to make the first move and just make music? 

     the deeper you get into that situation (your situation) you'll notice the prize gets higher and higher for just doing 'something' and finishing it. so shrink the project size and lower the bar until it is completely manageable. do a short thing and it doesn't matter what it is. then save it and date it and do your next thing

8.20.17  12:53 pm   if you ever met yourself, how do you think the conversation would go?

8.20.17  12:21 pm   have you ever used a french augmented sixth chord leading to a clean V in any of your music?

     you'll have to be more specific about 'french augmented 6th', i've never heard that term. and 'clean V' i assume means 5 triad? (i.e. g,b,e in key of c?)

8.20.17  10:21 am   Hey Bill, regarding the 8.19.17  1:53 am question about reading sheet music. I am not the guy/gal who asked this question. But I would like to know what step 2 is (I have some staff paper). I know how to read sheet music (I know the notes that correspond to the lines/spaces of the treble and bass clef), and I know how to read rhythmic notation... But I have a hard time actually just sight reading and playing a piece fluently without having to take a second to figure out each note/rhythm pattern. (Maybe i'm skipping a couple of steps in your step-by-step system)

     just go to the store and get a book of songs and start practicing. read just the melodies if you want. do it with a metronome. set it slow enough so that you can do it. maybe even be aware of you handicap compared to the original tempo, for example maybe 75% is reasonable. so if the song is marked 100bpm, set your metronome to 75. or maybe even 50 if you need to. and practice looking ahead. that's the key to the game

     i have made many songs before and i will make many in the future. i am sure you can find one or more that i have made or that i'm going to make which have similar vibes. additionally, most of the ones i make in the future will have videos, which will increase the likelyhood that you will latch onto it the way you have with the steve video

8.20.17  3:49 am   i always thought "F#sus" was a more common way to mean E/F# ,

     that would technically be F#9sus4. or F#7sus4, 9. and specifically no5. but as you can see it is much easier to just say E/F#

      been in situations that "F#, B, C#" was written as F#sus2 

     no that's Bsus2. or F#sus4. .... F#sus2 would be F#, G#, C#. if it's written without the number 2 or 4 it means 4

8.19.17  9:35 pm   why do you decide to create the scramble page? you know, the anagrams page.

     anagrams has been a hobby of mine for a long time. i always imagined it being on the site (there have been some stray ones posted to the expert page). just never got it together to decide on what formatting i wanted. then when people started requesting them last year through the questions page, i got an opportunity to do longer ones than i ever had before, which was thrilling, but also ridiculously time consuming, and problematic because it stalled the questions page. because i always do the questions in order. so it meant i had to either skip the anagram forever, or actually do it, and in the case of the very long ones i was spending 6 or 8 hours on one. this was while i was deep in the darkest depths of 'history of the entire world i guess'. so i knew the only solution was to make a dedicated anagrams page, with a request box, and just do them whenever i can, and not let it stall the questions page

8.19.17  9:29 pm   If you lived forever, do you think that life would become less meaningful? Or more? Would you Would you get bored after a few thousand years, or is there enough stuff in the universe that you would never run out of things to do? 

     everything would be completely different. but i think it would be reasonable. very different. exploratory and thorough to a degree we could barely imagine

8.19.17  9:24 pm   hey so i have this problem where i can't compliment myself in fear someone else will disagree with me. like, say i think my nose is nice. i like my nose, it's a good nose. well, there could be this other person that says "oh no your nose is really big it's not cute", and so on. what should i do because i think im a good person but there is always this voice in my head that says "no, look at yourself from someone else's point of view, you aren't fine" and i can never say anything good about myself, i just put myself down so no one else can and hurt me. do you have any solution for this? btw im not vain, i just don't think im awful.

     it's generally taboo to talk about your own good qualities. so join a cult with yourself and try to be the greatest person you possibly can and never tell anyone. show them instead

8.19.17  7:35 pm   i'm starting school in a few days and i have to take physics. i'm gonna get a few colored pens to make my notes more fun. what colors do you think i schould go for?

     i can't chose them until i see what the selection is. and even then, i'm still not going to make someone else's color decisions for them. you need to choose your own colors

8.19.17  7:34 pm   Howdy Bill! So I'm thinking about buying a bass to toy around with. I've been playing piano and playing in a band for a while. So I'm familiar with how to write bass lines, and how the bass fits in with the overall harmony/rhythm of a tune... But I really wanna learn how to actually play the thing! Couple questions for you... Bass strings? What are the advantages/disadvantages of round wound vs flat wound strings? Do they sound different, or is just a different feel to them when playing? Also, what are the advantages/disadvantages of using heavy gauge strings vs light gauge strings (different sound or just different feel)?

     you'll never believe this, but i'm actually not the right person to answer those questions. maybe in 5 years i will be

     One more question, how important do you think it is to learn "proper" right-hand technique?

     it's most important to make sure you're not hurting yourself. if something hurts, stop and relax and try to make sure you are doing everything at the most natural angles. try not to have your wrist bent too much. this especially goes for your left hand. this ultimately means you will have to set your strap really high. but i think if you are serious about the instrument you will put it high. this unfortunately could mean trouble with the fashion police if you happen to be living in the year 2000. but otherwise it should be fine

      I dabble on guitar a bit, so I think I can play the bass lines just fine.. but I want to make it sound good, which means more than just hitting the right note at the right time. Would you recommend watching videos showing right hand fingerin g techni que and all that kind of stuff? 

     maybe. i just use a regular finger technique. it's not that hard to figure out. but i guess there are a lot of different ways you could do it
